title: I am thinking of filing Ch. 7 bankruptcy. I owe fees to the California DMV for unpaid registration fees. I no longer own the car
question: Can I discharge those fees if I file bankruptcy.?I owe about $500 in unpaid fees.
answers: Most likely, Yes. You should treat it like any other unsecured debt and list it on the appropriate schedules and include them on your creditor's matrix so that they get notifiation of your bankruptcy case.

Typically, DVM fees & other fees not pertaining to crimes can be discharged through Chapter 7 bankruptcy. Be sure to list this debt and provide them with notice as you would for any creditor.

Hope this perspective helps!

Short (and sweet?) answer:

YES, you may discharge fees owed to DMV for registration on previously owned vehicle.


Best of luck!
